intro: Onychium micropterum, commonly known as the small-winged onychium, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and other related plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Onychium micropterum typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both horticulturists and botanists.
